comment: Sweet nose - for some reason I keep thinking of marshmallows as I nose it. Little nuttiness to go along with the sweet scent. Very smooth baking spices and maybe some green apple on the palate. Light vanilla fades to oak as the heat from the alcohol comes on with a cinnamon stick & rye spice. Honestly, this drinks like a 90 proof bourbon until the very end. This may have a spot in my top 10.

It’s been a while since I’ve had a kick from a whisky. This definitely packs a punch. Mellows our with an ice cube. 

Nose: mint fresh drier sheet. Delicate leather. 

Taste: spice that tickles the back of your nose. Cinnamon. 

Finish: pepper. Heat. 

It’s a great one. Great price. Lots going on. Will purchase again. Not for a casual drinker. It’ll put hair on your chest.
“Spicy” Excellent over a cube of ice

Nose: sweet, vanilla
Palate: dried fruit, tannic

 A little sharper than I was expecting, but good

One of the most unique bourbons you’ll ever taste. Nose is extremely sweet mixed with tons of cinnamon and floral notes. Bites exactly like bookers so i suggest splashing a bit of water. Must have for a collection. Drink sparingly.
Tremendous sweet and aromatic spiced nose. Caramely, sweet, viscous on the tongue. Not sharp and not bitter. Truly like nothing I’ve ever tasted. Will be buying more.
An excellent bourbon from top to bottom. Perfect finish of heat, flavor and drinkability
Has a nice spice to it towards the end.

The nose is very unique. One of my favorite smelling bourbons. The alcohol is very strong, I’ve tried it straight, with water, and ice. They’re all great. With water it’s very sweet and it brings out every single note you can’t get with all the alcohol in the way. However, after drinking 2-3 glasses with water i got turned off by the sweetness. It felt like i was drinking candy. It’s fruity, sweet, strong, and spicy. I highly recommend to add this to your collection/bucket list.

Nose: herbal tea, vanilla, oak. Alcohol, caramel, brown sugar, chocolate covered cherries, bonfire.

Palate: oak, medicinal cherry, corn, wood, dark chocolate.

Finish: spicy and medium to long, slightly hot.

Overall a great expression from willet, high proof thick Bourbon that needs time to sit and open up. Fairly complex at $40-$50. A clear winner.

N: light vanilla, sweet butterscotch
P: Vanilla bomb! Oily
F: Oak and char. Long finish
Love it. Gets better the more you drink. To 5 bourbons
Spicy, rich and oily flavor with a blast of cinnamon and vanilla. Clean finish with a slight bite.
Ice, neat, splash... still no dice. Harsher (proof?) than what I like. No appreciable headache.
Lots of cinnamon. Robust mouthfeel. Plenty of heat on the finish. Enjoy on a cold winter night
Nice cask strength heat with a long finish. I prefer Stagg Jr to this
Nice full bodied bourbon. Big spicy finish
This is easily one of the richest most full bourbons I’ve ever had. It is smooth for the proof, but has a nice spice at the finish.

Nice and fruit with with a hint of nut.
Big  smoky taste. For under $50, one of the best high proof bourbons on the market.
I didn’t like this at all. It’s a hot spicy mess. Couldn’t get past a couple of sips.
Really good. 57% feel takes over a tad but earthy, oily, and some spices/cinnamon come through. Above average finish
Carmel/citrus nose. A full, spicy flavor upfront and a Vanilla Coke finish. Proofy, but not as much as expecting being 114. One of my new favorites.
Heavy rye/floral start, but has sweet caramel finish with a little warm cinnamon feel when mixed with a little distilled water.
Good initial nose. NEAT: Taste a lightning bolt with a fair amount of burn. Burn on the way down. More harsh than I like. Will try with ice next.
Very smooth and easy to drink.
Visited Distilliary. Classic fav and go to. Incredibly Smooth

Color: beautiful copper

Aroma: vanilla gingerbread, cinnamon, maple, brown sugar, and ethanol

Taste: cinnamon spice and every bourbon thing nice, bold flavor and then it builds into creamy vanilla custard

Finish: long, baking spices and warmth

Smooth factor: B-
Tons of oak on the nose, very dry and woody.  Palate is also very dry with flavors of walnut...very interesting, unique bourbon
Very flavorful and not as much bite as you would expect from such a high abv

Nose: Vanilla, oak, mint, corn. Wonderfull nose. Taste: nuts, oak, ginger, pepper. 
Less sweet than most bourbons.
Finishes with little bit more sweetness with corn, oak and old wood.
Very big and complex. Smooth and sweet on the front end with solid spice on a lingering finish.
Sweet and nutty on the nose. Nutty, sweet, Barrel spice on the palate. Bold and complex with a strong finish. Excellent.
Deep bold flavor with spice and vanilla
Couple drops of water brings out the naturally sweet tones
A bigger, lusher, richer, bourbon that can be scooped up any day of the week. For now. No brainer if you enjoy a bigger bourbon.
Red hots and high proof. Needs ice, but has a ton of flavor.

Aroma - New Oak, Cinnamon Apple, Vanilla and hints of Candied Pecan
Texture - Smooth and Creamy
Flavor - Mint forward with Cinnamon and Maple Cream
Finish - Medium to Long with Fresh Grass, Toasted Oak and Black Pepper

Complex layers...Amazing!  Thanks Trey!
Strong. Very spicy at the start. Long finish that brings out an oak and vanilla flavors
Christmas spices with a touch of vanilla, short aftertaste. Very pleasant.
Nutty with like a raisin and plum note. Smells even like baked breads with sweet glazes on them. Very pleased.

Color: Amber. Oily with slow legs

Nose: Brown sugar, vanilla, oak, ripe stone fruit, hints of maple syrup

Palate: Vanilla, oak, stone fruits, rich and meaty, oily

Finish: Long finish with rye spice that crescendos in intensity. Heavy oak tannins sap your tongues moisture. Faint hint of mint in background.

Noah’s Mill is in my bourbon top 5 list. This dram isn’t for the faint of heart. Off the bat it’s hot the nose and palate but, letting it develop helps tamp the sharp edges. It’s very oak and vanilla forward throughout with ripe stone fruits bursting through. The intensity of the finish builds on the quicker side and after climaxing lingers for quite some time.
Cinnamon. Spicy. Vanilla. Has some heat, but not too much.
Brown sugar and orange peel vanilla
This is some pretty good stuff here! It bites in the end. Solid from the get go! Definitely getting more!
Nutty on the nose, nuts and spices on the pallet, completely coats your entire mouth, nice burn on the back end. Unique and solid pour for the price
Cinnamon and toffee, with a hint of vanilla, caramel, and nuts.  Nice spice upfront that doesn’t linger.

Oak is pronounced on the palate. (Noah tells me he's pretty old.)  As the sweetness and the wood swirl around, the liquid provides a thick, satisfactory mouthfeel.  A bit of dryness there.  The sweet notes continue to open up into the finish, as the oak and spice leaves the mouth tingling.  Very smooth for a 57% ABV.  The finish completes with hints of licorice, pine, and hot cinnamon candies.  

This is my new favorite bourbon.  So much so that I doubt I'll be able to keep this bottle stocked on my shelf for the next forty days and forty nights.



My Rating Glossary:  

Two Stars:           "I'd rather be drinking lite beer."
Two 1/2 Stars:    "Posh rubbish."
Three Stars:        "I love whisk(e)y.  This is average love."
Three 1/2 Stars: "May buy again."
Four Stars:          "I've got to get you into my life."
Four 1/2 Stars:   "Better than drugs."
Five Stars:           "Life is good.  Whisky makes it better."
Similar to Rowan’s Creek, but this is hotter, and has deeper caramel flavors. Really good.
Very bold and spicy overall with a lingering bite.
Sweet front end and slightly charred oaky finish

I definitely get the leather and a long, spicy finish. I normally steer clear of spicy, but I really like this. There's a lot going on with this.  It's freaky one sip can have three different stages, but I get three very distinct flavors with this initially, on the tongue, and then the finish.  One odd thing I've noticed both times I've tasted now though is that it leaves me throat feeling a bit raw, which other bourbons haven't done.
Full mouthy bourbon; sticks on the tongue and lingers; caramel and cream
Lots of vanilla and caramel like champagne but bourbon.
Notes of caramel. Has a strong kick but very tasty overall
Not terrible but didn’t live up to my expectations Based on the experts reviews.
About as close to perfect as a pour can be
Whoa - high proof with some bite. Spice and pepper, bust still like it.  Maybe Rowans has less bite.  Vanilla. Complex

I picked up a bottle but after a month or two of sippping it off and on I’m not blown away. I do enjoy the chocolate on the front end but it’s a little too hot. I feel the alcohol too much in this one and that’s usually the case of a lacking of flavors. I feel and taste the strength of the cinnamon and feel the abundance of this was to overcome the high alcohol but it was not efficient enough, for my pallet at least.

Aroma -  Strong Maple syrup and cinnamon blend together with sweet vanilla / Taste - Sweet heat and caramel swirl with leather and subtle fruit / finish - complex and long last finish that leave you wanting more.
finishes with caramel taste. Enjoyable Good initial tasting. I’m impressed
Solid... well rounded.... smooth, but with a bit. Sweetness is there but doesn’t linger long. Definitely a bourbon that stays with you.
Oakey and grassy, finishes with vanilla. Grassy flavor lingers. Lots of layers

Nose: chocolate, vanilla, oak, fresh berries, peach 

Palate: honey, light caramel, spicy without water. With water: sweet, smooth, light brown sugar

Finish: long, spicy, lingering, dry
Strong fruit notes throughout tasting (pear, apple, etc) small spice on the back end. A good daily drinker and price is reasonable.
Smooth and rich. Vanilla, caramel with a long finish. Great control over the high proof.

Oh hello. Glad to finally meet you. Just had the slightest taste from a friend but was left wanting more at a time where I can properly enjoy it. An interesting combination of smooth, sweet and potent, kind of like getting lightly punched in the face with a cinnamon stick marinated in vanilla.
Amazing and flavorful.   Very smooth for a strong bourbon.
Tastes like candy. Very very sweet on the nose with vanilla, butterscotch. Tastes like pecan pie
Spicy heat with cinnamon vanilla finish

Nose: brown sugar and vanilla, sweet. Taste: creamy, full, vanilla and brown sugar and caramel, light oak. Virtually no burn even with relatively high proof. One of my favorites. Will always have a bottle in my bar and will likely be my first bottle kill since the journey started.
Cherry, leather and goes down very smooth
Vanilla and cinnamon finish. Medium bun on finish. Very good whiskey
Caramel tones upfront. Very peppery finish.  Nice complex flavor. Overall very good.
